chapter.title: Getting Started
chapter.para: This chapter introduces the Web interface through which you use .

section.title: Welcome and Log In
section.para: When you connect to , you see the Welcome page. It has a list of the features in down the left-hand side, and items of recent news in the middle of the page.
Click Login to my account on the toolbar to log in. Enter your user ID, password and company name, then click Submit.

Your home page appears. This has a similar overall appearance to the Welcome page, but down the left-hand side is the main menu, and down the right-hand side is a portlet - an application runnning within the page - which is the module. This provides a calendar and lists of recent events.

The toolbar is the same on every page. There may be another toolbar above it, specific to your site; this is not covered in this documentation. At the left-hand end of the toolbar is a link to your Home page. At the right-hand end are three icons:
to log out,
to access the System Features menu, and
to display the online help.

The only function you are likely to want to use on the System Features menu is Change Profile, which you use to change your language and your password. All the modules for handling trades are available from your main menu.

section.title: Lists
section.para: Many functions display a page that lists relevant transactions. These list pages have many things in common:

itemizedlist.listitem: You can enter search criteria in a group of fields at the top of the page and click Search, to make the list show only records that match these criteria. These fields represent the most important fields in the transaction record, as do the columns in the table.
You can use wildcards in these fields. The wildcard character is an asterisk (*). You can use it anywhere in a field.

listitem.para: On pages where the list might be very long - for example, if there are many transactions - the list is not displayed until you have entered the search criteria and clicked Search. Enter an asterisk in any of the search fields to get the entire list.

itemizedlist.listitem:
If your company has entities defined in its profile, then a
column and a search criterion field for
Entity
appear in addition to the columns and fields mentioned in the individual chapters.

listitem.para: You can click the heading of a column to make a triangular icon appear, which you can then click to sort the list on that column, in ascending or descending order.

In most lists you can click in a row to process the transaction shown in that row. Depending on the list, you can edit, view, or delete the transaction, or create an amendment request for it. In some lists you click anywhere in the row; in some lists you click the System ID column; while some lists have icons you can click to edit, view or delete a transaction. Details are given in the sections for the individual functions.

section.title: Forms

listitem.para: Near the top right of a form, you'll see a free-floating menu on a coloured background, with the entries Show Form Summary and Top. This menu stays put as you scroll up and down the form. Clicking Top takes you back to the top of the form. Clicking Show Form Summary displays a menu of all the section headings in the form; you can click one to go straight to that section.

If a field has a
(magnifying glass) icon by it, you can click the icon to see a popup list of values. Click a value to insert it in the field. This is most often used for currency fields.

If a field has a
icon by it, you can click the icon to see a popup list of predefined phrases. Click a phrase to insert it in the field. You can then edit the field further. This is most often used for free-format fields such as Other Information fields.
In most date fields, you can enter the date in two ways:
Select the first option button to enter the required date. Click the field and select the date from the calendar.
Select the second option button to enter a length of time. Insert the number of days/weeks/months/years in the first field. Select from the dropdown list: Days, Weeks, Months or Years.

If a heading has a
icon by it, you can click the icon to expand the form, displaying a subsection that otherwise is not displayed. Click the
icon to close the subsection again.

section.para: This documentation describes each input form in detail, with a table describing each control (field, button, etc).

section.title: Date and Amount Formats
section.para: When entering a date in a date field, you can enter it in the form DD/MM/YYYY or DDMMYY if your locale is for instance France, or in the form MM/DD/YYYY or MMDDYY if your locale is for instance the USA..

informalexample.para: For example, entering 180401 produces a display of 18/04/2001, which in a French locale corresponds to 18th April 2001.

section.para: When you enter an amount, the system automatically formats the value entered according to the currency selected. You can either enter the amount using the decimal and group delimiters of your locale (for example, respectively [,] and [space] for France, or [.] and [,] for Singapore), or directly as a series of digits.

informalexample.para: For example, 123456.00 in a Singaporean locale produces a display of 123,456.00 if the currency involved is associated with 2 decimal places.
